How can I decode a hex-encoded script using Verus?

You can decode a hex-encoded script using the `decodescript` command. This command takes a hex-encoded string of the script as an argument. Here's an example of how to use it:

```
verus decodescript "hexstring"
```

Alternatively, you can use curl to make a JSON-RPC request:

```bash
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "decodescript", "params": ["hexstring"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
